title: UVM announces largest gift in school history
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - The University of Vermont on Friday announced the largest single gift in school history.
UVM graduate Steven Grossman has donated $20 million to the UVM School of Business. The school will be renamed the Grossman School of Business. The gift will fund three endowed academic positions: the Steven Grossman chairs in entrepreneurship, finance and sustainable business. It will also provide resources to support teaching and program priorities.
UVM President Tom Sullivan said, "This will make UVM a magnet to attract the best faculty and scholars."
Grossman was a member of the class of 1961. He was CEO of the Southern Container Corp. until it was sold in 2008. Since 2010, he has been a trustee of the Grossman Family Foundation.
The previous record gift to UVM was back in 2003, when Steven and Beverly Rubenstein donated $15 million to create the Rubenstein School of Environment and Natural Resources.
